prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, similar to a solid slice of bread. This part will serve as the base for the final cylindrical object. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with Euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. This will position the base part correctly in the final assembly. 2. **Draw the 2D sketch** on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. a. Create a square face, face_1, by drawing 4 lines. - Line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0], Ending at [0.75, 0.0]. - Line 2: Starting at [0.75, 0.0], Ending at [0.75, 0.75]. - Line 3: Starting at [0.75, 0.75], Ending at [0.0, 0.75]. - Line 4: Starting at [0.0, 0.75], Ending at [0.0, 0.0]. 3. **Scale the 2D sketch** by a factor of 0.75. 4. **Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** by applying the coordinate system's position and orientation. 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch** to a depth of 0.2812 along the normal direction of the sketch plane. This will create the three-dimensional rectangular prism, adding material. Part 2: Cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom Create a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom, resembling a rounded slice of bread with tapered ends. This part will sit atop the base part to form the final cylindrical object. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with Euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and a translation vector of [0.0938, 0.4687, 0.0938]. This will position the tapered part correctly in the final assembly. 2. **Draw the 2D sketch** on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. a. Create face_1 and draw two circles, loop_1 and loop_2. Both circles should have their center at [0.2812, 0.2812] but with different radii. - Circle 1 (loop_1): Radius: 0.2812 - Circle 1 (loop_2): Radius: 0.1875 3. **Scale the 2D sketch** by a factor of 0.5625, accounting for the circular dimensions of the new part. 4. **Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** by applying the coordinate system's position and orientation. 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch** to a depth of 0.4687 along the normal direction of the sketch plane, adding to the material in the previous part. The shape is now a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. After completing these steps, the CAD model will be a cylindrical object with a rectangular top and a slightly tapered top, fulfilling the design requirements provided in the CAD Assembly JSON.</description>
